item.description:
Here's the ultimate recycling activity -- making new sheets of paper from used paper. This workshop covers some basic techniques of paper making. I'll show how to make the pulp, but most will be ready to use to save us time and limit the time the blender is in use.

The paper we'll make is perfect for greeting cards, use in other art projects, holiday ornaments and more. (The green pattern on each side of this web page is a scan of my handmade paper). You’ll get a chance to make several sheets. We’ll also experiment with making irregular shapes and molded paper.

WHAT TO WEAR: We’ll be on our feet a lot of the time so wear comfortable shoes and expect to get a little wet. Some paper we use may not be colorfast so you might want to have an apron or old coverup to put on. 

WHAT TO BRING:  A couple of old kitchen or hand towels to dry your hands and carry your damp paper home.  (Optional) Rubber or latex gloves.

DAY/TIME: Saturday, November 5th, from 1:00 pm to ???? (Really, we'll stay as late as anybody wants to stay!) The first few hours are the most important. Daylight Savings Time ends the next morning so we have a bonus hour!

AMENITIES: Free parking. Table space and a chair. Access to some tools (paper cutter, heat gun, some aprons, etc.). Access to a fridge, microwave, toaster oven, kitchen sink and restroom. 

COST: $20 to help defray the cost of Studio rental and provided materials.

WHO MAY ATTEND: Any member of the NE ATC+ Meetup and up to two guests, 18+ (we're going to be adding workshops for younger participants soon).

HOW TO SIGN UP: These smaller sessions are often full with a waiting list. Reserve a place by RSVP-ing "yes" using Meetup's RSVP function. Please RSVP for your guests as well.

If your plans (or your guests' plans) change, PLEASE update your RSVP accordingly. Please do this right up to the start time of the event.   

CANCELLATIONS: In the unlikely event that we need to cancel---or even if we're just getting a late start--we'll post a message on the Web site and e-mail everyone who's RSVP'd "yes." So to be on the safe side, please check the Web site and your inbox before departing for ArtStudio 360. If we don't have a minimum of 4 participants I may change this to an Open Studio.

Contact me if you have any questions, Pat.
item.how_to_find_us: The studio is on the second floor -- no elevator.

group.name: New England Artist Trading Cards Plus (ATCs+) Meetup Group

item.name: Paper Making Workshop -- Saturday, November 5th - 1 pm
